cheatsheet.title: Getting started with TOP20 self assessments

intro.description:
Welcome to verinice TOP20 self assessments!
This tutorial will help you to conduct your first TOP20 self assessment!

item.title: Create a new self assessment
item.description:
First you have to create a new self assessment. You should be in the self assessment perspective. If not, you can go there by choosing from the menu: View -> Show Perspective... -> Self-Assessment Perspective.
You will find the Self-Assessment view on left side of the Window.

item.title: Create a new self-assessment
item.description:
Click the NEW button in the self-assessment view or choose from the menu: File -> Add new Self-Assessment
The new self-assessment will appear in the view. Double-click on it to bring up the editor view. Change the name from "My Company" to your actual company's name.
Save by clicking on File -> Save or by pressing the keys Ctrl-S.

item.title: Open the first category
item.description:
Expand the self assessment by clicking the small arrow to the left of the node's icon. Expand "Controls" and then the first category by clicking the small arrow on the left.
You should be able to see a number of categories from "Security Policy" to "Access Control". These categories contain questions that will help you to evaluate your current information security level for the most important topics.

item.title: Answering questions
item.description:
Double-click on the first question to open the editor. Simultaneously, the Control Browser will show you the question and a selection of maturity levels.
Read the descriptions to decide which maturity level you have reached in your organization. You may have to consult other employees or do some internal research to answer the question correctly.
Choose the correct maturity level in the editor below the browser view. You can also add a public comment. This comment will be included in a database export. You can also add a private comment just for yourself. The private comment will always stay in your local database.
Save cour changes by pressing Strg-S or by choosing File -> Save.

item.title: Generate a report
item.description:
Continue in the same way with the next question. As you go along, you will notice that the spider chart in the bottom left corner of the screen begins to reflect your answers. When you have answered all questions honestly, you will have a good overview about your current information security situation.
When you are done answering all questions, you may want to generate a report for management or another party. You can do so by choosing File -> Self-Assessment -> Generate Report....
Choose the type of report and a filename under which the report should be saved, then click OK.

item.title: Export results
item.description:
When you are done answering all questions, you can export your results to send them to another party. You can do so by choosing File -> Self-Assessment -> Export to file...
You have to choose a filename under which the report will be saved. The exported file is always encrypted, so you also have to choose a password or a certificate for encryption. Once you're done, press OK.

item.title: Finished
item.description:
Congratulations on conducting your first self-assessment of your information security status. If you wish to go further and are thinking about actually establishing an information security management system (ISMS) in your company, you can go back to the welcome screen by choosing Help -> Welcome.
This time, select the option "Establish an ISMS". You will be directed to the ISM Perspective with another tutorial to guide you.
item.onCompletion: This concludes this tutorial. Don't forget to go to verinice.org for more information and news!
